item.title: Why were the trees cut down in whitehall lane as theres no access to severn trent, 7th August
item.description:
Mrs Hazel Rees is enquiring why the trees were cut down in Whitehall Lane as there is no access to Severn Trent.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Green, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain obstructed and water is washing away a dip in the road, 7th August
item.description:
The drain next to Birdlip View is obstructed by overgrown verge. Water coming down the hill has been bypassing the drain and following the road around to the left which goes down a lane to Ruby's. The water is washing away the highway in front of our property entrance from the highway, creating a dip which is causing vehicles to ground their front and rear as they enter and exit our property. The water is also washing debris from the road down the lane to Ruby's. The issue has been present since we moved in at the start of July 2024. The verge needs to be cleared from around the drain to encourage water to go down it, AND the dip in the highways in front of our entrance needs to be filled in with tarmac to raise back up to being level with the adjacent highway and remove the severe dip which has been created. Tarmac is needed rather than loose chippings because chippings will be washed down the lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
